page.title: 09 A BRERETON WOMAN'S DAY.
page.content: It's up bright and early 8.00a.m. sharp. Into the bathroom she goes and gets ready. She has breakfast then books a taxi to take her to town at 9.30am. From 8.00 t0 9.30. she does the housework, hoovering, washing and dusting. When the taxi arrives she goes to "Lo-Cost" Superstore to do the shopping, then returns home. Then she gets ready and walks to the fish-bar. A fish-bar is a place where you can buy cooked food, like fish and chips and other foods. When she gets there she serves people with what they want Sometimes she gets a little burnt because when you put the chips in the hot fat it spits. She is there for 8 hours and gets very tired. When she gets home she goes to bed.
